Text.Value: Curious, have you had a chance of heart? Or forgotten our little agreement? Turn this wayward child over to me, and you shall go free, with Lady Shar's faithful as your allies.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to GROUP_Players rather than SH
EditorData.NodeContext: Addressed to GROUP_Players rather than SH. Referring to an earlier agreement they made to betray SH.

Text.Value: They already heard how you disgraced yourself before Lady Shar. How she marked you as the enemy. But it is quite another thing for them to see it for themselves.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia awaits SH. A sharran audience in the wings murmurs their disgust as SH appears

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar,  and serve Shar

Text.Value: It's true. She survived the Gauntlet of Shar. She sacrificed Sel√ªne's own daughter. She is your rightful leader.
I am very glad you decided to return. A cautionary tale such as yours will be studied by Lady Shar's initiates for years to come.
You there - remember our agreement? Surrender her to me, now, and you can consider Lady Shar's forces your allies in the battles to come.
I've heard enough. Deal with this lot how you wish, Shadowheart.
You keep such shrewd companions, Shadowheart. A shame you didn't learn from them. Seize her.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Two sharrans approach Shadowheart. The player watches as she's hauled away.

Text.Value: Keep silent.
Always a pleasure to see old acquaintances. But you would be wise to not interfere in this matter.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

Text.Value: I thought you might try to flee, rather than face us. Perhaps you are braver than I thought - or more arrogant than even I can fathom.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia awaits SH. Shar followers watch from the sides.

Text.Value: So let the others fight, while we wait. Once they are spent and bloodied from each other, we would slip in and take the prize. Alas, most of those I sent, perished. All but one.
I shall stand with Shadowheart.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A group of sharrans move to Shadowheart's back.
EditorData.NodeContext: Swearing fealty (having just changed sides to support the player)

Text.Value: It's true. She survived the Gauntlet of Shar. She sacrificed Sel√ªne's own daughter. She is your rightful leader.
Give Shadowheart a chance to sway more of Viconia's followers.
Connect with her mind. Suggest she talk about the power Shar granted her.
Lady Shar's concerns lie elsewhere - with another. But she is a goddess... she can afford to ignore that which does not threaten her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hint of tension between her and her goddess. Their goals aren't aligned

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar,  and serve Shar

Text.Value: I saw her walk through a shadow curse, where others feared to venture. Shar favours her.
No! Were you meaning to backstab me all along, or did you lose your spine along the way?
No matter. I built this place from nothing - I can always start anew once you've been dealt with.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The final contingent of Viconia's followers abandon her.

Text.Value: A true Sharran like you must be on the right side.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The sharrans' murmurs grow more animated. One shouts out in support.
EditorData.NodeContext: Supportive, swayed by the player's argument

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar,  and serve Shar

Text.Value: It's true. She survived the Gauntlet of Shar. She sacrificed Sel√ªne's own daughter. She is your rightful leader.

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You wear the armour of a Dark Justiciar

Text.Value: It's true. She survived the Gauntlet of Shar. She sacrificed Sel√ªne's own daughter. She is your rightful leader.
Viconia would have you hide down here, oblivious to the true danger - the Absolute must be stopped, and only I can lead you. Lady Shar has decreed it!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart addresses the Sharran audience

Text.Value: She's all yours.

EditorData.NodeContext: Outraged. The player is betraying Shadowheart Viconia in spite of promising not to do such a thing before.

Text.Value: I saw her walk through a shadow curse, where others feared to venture. Shar favours her.
You thought you could best the Absolute? The githyanki?
As you like.
Shadowheart has nothing to prove to the likes of you.
L'il Alurl! For Shar!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attack
EditorData.NodeContext: l-ill allure

Text.Value: It's true. She survived the Gauntlet of Shar. She sacrificed Sel√ªne's own daughter. She is your rightful leader.
Nonsense. Ravings. You've strayed, girl - you've failed Lady Shar's mission and allowed ambition to rot your mind.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Murmurs reverberate from the onlooking Sharrans. Viconia scowls.

Text.Value: And she told me to cleanse her church of those who failed her.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart points at Viconia on 'those who failed her'.

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar, and wear the armour of one

Text.Value: It's true. She survived the Gauntlet of Shar. She sacrificed Sel√ªne's own daughter. She is your rightful leader.
Use the parasite. Urge Shadowheart to speak of the Absolute threat. Only she can lead them to victory.
Enough. I don't answer to you. Not anymore. I'm here for my family.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia's brow raises as SH mentions her family.

Text.Value: The traitors' ranks swell - like a corpse left under the sun. I will take joy in making each and every one of you suffer.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Another group of Sharrans break from the fold and side with Shadowheart. There is perhaps now an even split between the two. Viconia lambasts those who changed sides.

Text.Value: That's all? Why any back-alley cut-throat could earn the Dark Lady's blessing in those circumstances. You are deluded, girl.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The onlooking Sharrans are unimpressed - none join Shadowheart's side. Viconia smiles and speaks to them.

Text.Value: I did not consent to questions. But I suppose you have undergone a great deal to reach this place, and anything I tell you cannot compromise me now - for you will either leave on my terms, or not at all...

EditorData.NodeContext: Icy threat in the first sentence, then relenting a little - 'might as well toss 'em a bone'.

Text.Value: Wait - I have to know, before it's too late. Why did you want the Astral Prism?
Likewise.

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant, glaring at Viconia while responding to Player  (Enemy of Shar path - SH is here to save her parents)

Text.Value: She slew a helpless prisoner, deep in an ancient ruin. Perhaps that warrants Shar's blessing.
The artefact was your last chance to prove yourself - and you squandered it.
I'm not here to convince you, Mother. You are already disgraced in Lady Shar's eyes. I merely wish to give the others a chance to repent, before they are dragged down with you.
You see? She is nothing but a deluded girl trying to bluff her way out of our rightful judgement - nothing more.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The onlooking Sharrans are unimpressed - none join Shadowheart's side. Viconia smiles and speaks to them.

Text.Value: I should thank you. If you hadn't sent me on that suicide mission, I'd never have learned the truth.

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant, addressed to Viconia (Enemy of Shar path - SH is here to save her parents)

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar, and wear the armour of one

Text.Value: I saw her walk through a shadow curse, where others feared to venture. Shar favours her.
I must keep her faith alive in mortal hearts. I must defend her ways, lead her children, stop all threats. Even if I must go against her wishes, I will prove myself her most loyal servant.

EditorData.NodeContext: Self-righteous

Text.Value: You there - surrender this one to me, now, and you can consider Lady Shar's forces your allies in the battles to come.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player

Text.Value: Fear not - remember the terms of our little agreement? Turn this wayward child over to me, and you shall go free, with Lady Shar's faithful as your allies.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to GROUP_Players rather than SH
EditorData.NodeContext: Addressed to GROUP_Players rather than SH. Referring to an earlier agreement they made to betray SH.

Text.Value: I saw her walk through a shadow curse, where others feared to venture. Shar favours her.
The Absolute will be dealt with. As soon as I prise the artefact from your cold fingers.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The onlooking Sharrans are unimpressed - none join Shadowheart's side. Viconia smiles and speaks to them.

Text.Value: What? No!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shocked expression

Text.Value: Shar doesn't care. She was always going to use you and discard you - but now I'm going to deal with you first.

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant, addressed to Viconia (Enemy of Shar path - SH is here to save her parents)

Text.Value: Whispers reached my ears from all corners - potential rivals of Lady Shar, all vying for the same prize. A new god, amassing the disaffected, the outcasts - those who should turn to us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

Text.Value: You think you know better than the Dark Lady? No wonder she sent me to this place of your poison.

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant. Addressed to Viconia. (shar path - committed to her goddess and on a mission to overthrow her superior)

Text.Value: I don't know what she's talking about.
I saw her walk through a shadow curse, where others feared to venture. Shar favours her.
Do nothing.
Shar bid you to do all of this?
Shar bid you to do all of this?
No matter. You are here now, to face the Dark Lady's judgement, before a gathering of your peers. Give the artefact, and perhaps we will be merciful.
Never.
Tell them what you witnessed. Tell them how Lady Shar favours me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressed to the player, seeking support. (shar path - committed to her goddess and on a mission to overthrow her superior)

Text.Value: I've heard enough.
I had to act. I had to strangle that foul conspiracy while it was still in the cradle.

EditorData.NodeContext: Impassioned, verging on fanaticism

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar,  and serve Shar

Text.Value: I saw her walk through a shadow curse, where others feared to venture. Shar favours her.
Now, do not be so foolish as to attack me. Unlike before, I am flesh and blood - but am very well protected.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cautioning - reference to how the player attacked an illusion of Viconia earlier while not aware it wasn't actually her.

Text.Value: Such misplaced camaraderie. How about this - surrender this one to me, now, and you can leave freely, and consider Lady Shar's forces your allies in the battles to come.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to GROUP_Players rather than SH
EditorData.NodeContext: Addressed to GROUP_Players rather than SH. Offering them a way out if they betray SH.

Text.Value: I said I'd bring you Shadowheart - she's all yours.
We learned all we could - the artefact was the one thing the Absolutists feared. The one thing they desperately wanted to keep out of their enemies' grasp. I had to have it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Impassioned, verging on fanaticism

Text.Value: Shar bid you to do all of this?
You were right about one thing - Lady Shar's church does need to be cleansed. By my hand.
Pin your eyes to the treacherous she-drow. Do not focus on the many, many others - Boo will handle them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Low tones, strategising / advising player - the party will handle Viconia, Boo will take the dozens of other Sharrans in the gallery.

Text.Value: You thought you could best the Absolute? The githyanki?
I've heard enough.
You thought you could best the Absolute? The githyanki?
I sank a spear into the heart of the Moonwitch's daughter. Lady Shar rewarded me - she turned the pain that once held me back into the power that now drives me on.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gives you a small nod before speaking to the Sharrans.

Text.Value: But perhaps I can make a case for some small measure of mercy. Give me the artefact, and I can at least make this quick.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Node is optional if LOW_SharGrotto_ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart previously covered the topic of the artefact sufficiently,

Text.Value: *A coup attempt. Shadowheart will need all the help she can get if she's to win over the remaining diehards from Viconia's ranks.*
Attack immediately.
Tell her. Tell them all. Tell them how the Nightsinger has blessed me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart addresses the player

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You wear the armour of a Dark Justiciar,  and serve Shar

Text.Value: It's true. She survived the Gauntlet of Shar. She sacrificed Sel√ªne's own daughter. She is your rightful leader.
That's right. I know what you did. And it's not going to be quick - not for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: She just told Viconia she knows her parents are alive.  'That's right' is following from Viconia's expression reacting to this.

Text.Value: Enough talk, girl. The sooner we finish this, the sooner your blood can be sluiced off Lady Shar's sacred Grotto.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressing Shadowheart

Text.Value: This 'Absolute' is but an upstart; disturbing the natural order and threatening to impede the glorious return of Lady Shar's pure, endless darkness.
So be it. A traitor's end awaits you all. These are the desperate lies of trapped vermin, nothing more. You are deluded, girl.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia watches angrily before shouting to the Sharrrans.
EditorData.NodeContext: First part (up to 'awaits you all') addressed to Sharrans who have abandoned her. Middle (up to 'nothing more' addressed to her remaining supporters. Last part directed at shadowheart.

Text.Value: It's true. She survived the Gauntlet of Shar. She sacrificed Sel√ªne's own daughter. She is your rightful leader.
Why is the artefact so important to you?

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar,  and serve Shar

Text.Value: I saw her walk through a shadow curse, where others feared to venture. Shar favours her.
To fight so many foes openly could prove unwise. Shar's children are better deployed as daggers in the shadows, not massed upon a battlefield.
Enough speeches - the odds are already in my favour. Do you think the Dark Lady would want you to die for a lost cause? Or show some cunning and live another day?
L'il Alurl! For Shar!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attack
EditorData.NodeContext: l-ill allure

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You wear the armour of a Dark Justiciar

Text.Value: I saw her walk through a shadow curse, where others feared to venture. Shar favours her.
This was a mistake. We shouldn't have come here.
Wait. Before we go any further, tell me what this is about. Why do you even want the artefact?
This is your family. And now you have turned your back on it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Small sweep of her right hand at the general surrounds.
EditorData.NodeContext: Small sweep of her right hand at the general surrounds. Referring to the onlooking Shar worshippers

Text.Value: You've finally found yourself a following, Mother Superior. And you only had to hollow out their heads to do it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mocking - Viconia is declaiming in front of an audience

Text.Value: You can still leave, if you are wise - surrender this one to me, now, and you can consider Lady Shar's forces your allies in the battles to come.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to GROUP_Players rather than SH
EditorData.NodeContext: Addressed to GROUP_Players rather than SH. Offering them a way out if they betray SH.

Text.Value: Lady Shar protected me. She guided me, elevated me. And now she wants me to cast you down.

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant. Addressed to Viconia. (shar path - committed to her goddess and on a mission to overthrow her superior)

Text.Value: No. I already faced Lady Shar. I passed her trials, I wielded her spear, and now I am her mortal voice. I have been embraced by her in ways you could only dream of.

Synopsis: Shadowheart confronts Viconia about her past and potentially the leadership of the cult itself. Alternatively, she may be here to free her parents, if she has abandoned Shar. The player can support her efforts and help her defeat Viconia, or else betray her.
